Base Station Positioning

2024 02 27

In the quest for enhanced location accuracy, base station positioning emerges as an indispensable tool for augmenting GPS technology. This paper begins by employing a channel attenuation model to preprocess the collected data through a series of steps, including outlier detection, median filtering, and Kalman filtering, aimed at accurately estimating the propagation exponent and precisely simulating the environment. Subsequently, it integrates measurements from multiple base stations, assigning different weights to each, to refine the data processing approach further. Ultimately, through iterative application of the least squares method, this project successfully achieves precise location determination.
